TopicTitle: Why doesn't KSP recognize my NES controller?

Articles.Content: Oh, I should say that it's hooked up to the computer with one of [URL="https://jet.com/product/detail/f180b4022f9d44aaa27153b04bfa2a48?jcmp=pla:ggl:cwin_electronics_a3:video_game_console_accessories_a3_other:na:na:na:na:na:2&code=PLA15&k_clickid=60ae4b8b-ff18-43d8-a2a4-9208403ddd13&gclid=CjwKEAiAmqayBRDLgsfGiMmkxT0SJADHFUhPZwnCavE2Ri6eAetzh52rDRmC_D8o39d67PDroKfmbxoCY2bw_wcB"]these things[/URL]. It should have gamepad support too....
Check the drivers or whatever you use to control those things (IDK), because it might not only be the KSP, it might be your computer.
On a less helpful note.... how does an NES controller handle roll control?

You'd probably map pitch and roll, and ditch yaw - at least for planes. Which I assume is the plan, since planes are more the "fly for fun" kind of thing than rockets, which are more utilitarian vehicles.

I would say the problems at the OS oe driver level. KSP will support any standard controller.

But a NES pad? That's really barebones. I guess you'll have pitch, yaw, throttle up, throttle down, and stage.
